intro: Pseudocorchorus greveanus, commonly known as the African thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
